content.question: Gallium, <math alttext="G a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ga</mi></math>, reacts with chlorine gas to produce gallium(<math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>III</mtext></math>) chloride. When the equation for the reaction is balanced with lowest whole-number coefficients, the coefficient for gallium is

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
